Posts.Content: Magdalena20 wrote: Hello community, I've been very worried for quite sometime ever since my first cousin from my fathers side passed away from breast cancer at 30. I've discovered a very painful lump underneath my breast were the (bra-line) would be. I can't wear bras they are very aggravating due to it. I've noticed it gets bigger as time goes by especially during my period. After my period the lump is still painful. I have gone to the doctor 2 days ago, he said it's a possible cyst to the edge of my breast tissue. I'm very worried I have an ultrasound tomorrow and I'm losing my mind. My doctor said we need to check if it's for sure a cyst and that's when I got really scared :( I've searched how common breasts cyst are, and their more common in women from ages 30-40. Should I be a bit worried or am I worrying too much for nothing. Everyone thinks I'm looking for problems/health issues when that's not really the case. Thank you! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 20 years old with lump under edge of breast tissue! Magdalena20 Magdalena20

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2016 10:09PM - edited Jul 12, 2016 10:12PM by Magdalena20 Hello Marie! And thanks for stopping by! I appreciate it. This is what it says for the left breast! Because the right one is normal. It specifically states your patient Magdalena received birads 4 or 5 on their breast imaging report.
Posts.Title: 20 years old with lump under edge of breast tissue! Magdalena20 Magdalena20

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2016 10:53PM - edited Jul 14, 2016 11:01PM by Magdalena20 Girlie, I'm sorry you're going through such a stressful time, I know exactly how that feels. Especially being young and naive many things are new and scary to us, especially feeling your first lump that you never knew was there, or knew was there but ignored it from being scared. When it comes to breast health, us women are more prone to thinking on the negative side about lumps, indents, and breast changes. Confronting someone you love and who brought you to this world is very stressing and scary, especially because you dont want them to worry. You should feel confident!! I'm sure your mom will be understanding and will want you to be honest with her at the end of the day. Dont feel scared, the more you wait the more stressful its going to be and that stress wont make breast worries or any worries better. I guarantee you will feel much more at ease telling your mom, not only that you will have someone who you trust and love to be by your side throughout this. I confronted my mom after I went to the breast ultrasound. I didn't feel right not letting her know that i'm getting one, especially on my breast! Breast indents, can be caused for many reasons, fibrous tissue, maybe the indent looks like a stretch mark.. On behalf of your anxiety and worry towards your breast indent, get it checked out by a doctor. Dont waste time ignoring the issue because your worried, it will just make you stressed. I'm here for you! Keep me updated :) P.S thanks for wishing me B9 results! :)
Posts.Title: 20 years old with lump under edge of breast tissue! Magdalena20 Magdalena20

Posts.Content: Jul 18, 2016 07:36PM - edited Jul 18, 2016 07:37PM by Magdalena20 Hello everyone, I'm back from the hospital visit. The doctor said she doesn't think its anything and possibly a hamatoma because a fibroadenoma would be hard to the touch. She didn't give me the biopsy. She sent me to another better quality ultrasound, to compare the two sonography's. Fingers crossed, hopefully after that its still nothing. P.S hope everyones well!

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2016 10:35AM Magdalena20 wrote: Biopsy is done, smooth procedure didn't feel anything. The only thing that was painful was my arm being numb, from keeping it behind so much (losing circulation) the doctor said I have very very dense breast tissue, so the procedure took longer than usual. They took 10 samples. I have a slight headache and going to get some rest now
Posts.Title: 20 years old with lump under edge of breast tissue! Magdalena20 Magdalena20

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2016 04:44PM - edited Jul 14, 2016 04:48PM by Magdalena20 Hello, Just a quick update! My visit at the hospital is this Monday. The hospital told me I needed to get a copy of my ultrasound video to take to this hospital...? Kinda weird but whatever. Apparently the breast doctor wants to take a better look at it and examine my breast before suggesting a biopsy. Btw, i've been non-stop researching stuff thats on my radiologist report. I dont know how the height width and size go on these reports but.. apparently (taller than wide) are more commonly malignant, and (wider than tall) are commonly benign. My breast nodule thats hyperechoic has a long axis parrallel to my chest wall. Usually fibroadenomas are wider than thinner. I'm freaking out.. I just keep searching and searching.

Posts.Content: Jul 12, 2016 01:54PM Magdalena20 wrote: Hello, I have gotten my results and i'm quite frightened. On my right breast I have a 0.3cm hypoechoic superficial nodule. The Radiologist favors its likely a beign entity, possibly a small fibroadenoma. He recommends a 6 month follow-up to ensure stability. The right breast appears normal. On the left side which I never even knew I had something is were the bad stuff starts to begin, and when my heart stopped. On the left side at the upper outer quadrant at 2-3 o'clock there is a well-defined hyperechoic nodule at 2.9cm. It has a long axis parallel to my chest wall. This could be on the basis of a fibroadenoma or possibly a hamartoma. Appears however nonspecific and I would recommend proceeding to ultrasound guided core biopsy. On my BIRADS categories i'm in 4. Suspicious 5. High suggestive of malignancy My world has dropped on my shoulders. I'm a college student for practical nursing and I dont know how i'm going to focus on my studies now. My mom is very worried and I feel like a burden. I'm very worried and scared.
Posts.Title: 20 years old with lump under edge of breast tissue! Magdalena20 Magdalena20

Posts.Content: Jul 15, 2016 11:55AM - edited Jul 17, 2016 04:14PM by Magdalena20 Dear Girlie, I'm happy my message made you feel at ease. I would suggest you do get the appointment so you can feel better knowing your taking charge of the situation. As for college, if your planning to attend in fall that's a long time from now, and I guarantee your situation will be dealt with before then. To be very honest, I can only stop my mind from going at worst scenarios for probably about 15 minutes. My mind just goes right back to being negative and thinking the worst. It's Friday here in Canada and I have another 2 days before my appointment at the hospital. Try to read a book, workout, go out with friends, be around people that make you feel happy and talk to them, dont keep your thoughts to yourself because it will make you feel so much better knowing someone understands. Dont search stuff on google, thats what I do everyday and every hour since I heard I have a some non-specific appearances on my breast nodule. If your on summer break enjoy it! At the end of the day, you're only 18 and breast cancer in your age group is very very uncommon. Keep me updated
Posts.Title: 20 years old with lump under edge of breast tissue! Magdalena20 Magdalena20

Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2016 04:14PM - edited Jul 17, 2016 04:15PM by Magdalena20 Girlie, We should be enjoying ourselves, you are totally right! I'm quite sure you cant be in advanced stages, i'm sure your breast would show extreme symptoms if you were in advanced stages. You will be perfectly fine, your breast are still developing at 18. Monday is almost around the corner, I go to the hospital tomorrow :/ quite frightened. Let me know we you get the appointment with your doctor.
